page.title: 11MANSE FARM, CUDWORTH
page.content: {Mr Cooke}has had the{farm}for 23 years; most of its buildings are old but there are a few modern barns. Altogether they have{140 acres; 100 {acres}are used to grow winter/spring {corn and barley.}They farm the land the modern way and use{3 tractors,}2 Ford and 1 John Deere, and they have a Massey Ferguson combine harvester. Most of the hay and straw is sold but three quarters of the barley is kept to feed the animals; they have{6 milk {cows, a herd of beef cows and 16 pigs, {15 sows and a boar.}There is a sty with bars to stop the sow treading on the piglets. The piglets are fed on barley. Mr Cooke does not buy his milk but gets it from his cows. The farm employs 3 members of the family and the{hours of work are from 0730 to {2300.
